_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:23:52 using v2.1
title: How does people with learning disabilities living in their own home vary across England?
analysis_commentary: In 2012/13 there was a large variation between the different regions in England in terms of the portion of people with learning disabilities living in their own home or with their family. Values ranges from 85.3% in the North West to 66.0% in West Midland- a difference of over 19%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care - Combined Activity Return (ASC-CAR)
